result.execSummary:
The defendant Herman J Beuth III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).
  • Exposing Genitals, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
As to each count: Pay all costs and surcharges.
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA samples and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  
Court set restitution at $0.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for
186 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain fulltime employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Vocational/educational training.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No contact with drug community.
No contact with E.B. and her family during initial confinement.  Contact is allowed during extended supervision with consent of E.B. and her family and approval of agent.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 years.
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.

Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Random urine screens.
Absolute sobriety.  No drugs or alcohol.

charges.descr: Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.

records.addlTxt: per order dated May 10, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1801-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDEREED that this summary disposition order will not be published and may not be cited under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.23(3)(b).

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Herman J Beuth in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Herman J Beuth in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state and defense.  No statement by defendant.  Additional statements by Crystal B.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 186 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

As to each count:  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*Absolute sobriety.  No drugs or alcohol.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with E.B. and her family during initial confinement.  Contact is allowed during extended supervision with consent of E.B. and her family and approval of agent.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 years.
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay all costs and surcharges

As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA samples and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.  

Court set restitution at $0.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;

Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Crystal B processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26209711 in court 2x on 6/22 &23/15.
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits, filed.

SAME APPERANCES......

At the hour of 1:17 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and preserved defense motion(s) subject to the filing of any motion(s)/rulings on motion(s).  The Court to allow oral motion by defense on the next date.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  The Court orders the defendant REMANDED into custody pending sentencing.  
Filed:
- jury notes (x3);
-court response to jury (x2).

Defendant Herman J Beuth in court with Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant in custody.  
Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Jury Trial.  All jurors present; deliberations resumed at 9:00 a.m.  At 9:18 a.m. requested exhibits sent to jurors.  
The Court addresses jury questions on the record at 10:39 a.m.  and 11:25 a.m.  Court in recess awaiting verdict.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

SAME APPEARANCES......

Trial continued.  The Court informs of issue with juror #13.  Juror #13 in open court for questioning.  The Court orders juror #13 excused at this time; jury duty to be rescheduled.  No objection from the state or defense.  Juror #13 advised that failure to appear  for jury duty may result in action by the court.  Jury in at 1:30 p.m.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Brandt Ungerer.  Exhibit #15 received into evidence and published.  The state rests.  Jury out at 1:52 p.m.  The defendant waives right to testify.  The Court reviews waiver form with the defendant and accepts waiver.  Jury in at 2:00 p.m.  Sworn for defense:  Milwaukee Police Officer Jody Young.  Exhibit #2 offered and received into evidence.  Defense rests.  Jury out at 2:24 p.m.  Exhibit #16 offered and received into evidence.  Court in recess to conduct jury instruction conference with counsel.  Case recalled.  The Court sets forth instructions selected by the state and defense.  Jury in at 2:49 p.m.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:04 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies W. Adam and B. Miers who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury released for the day at 4:45 p.m.
Case continued to 6-24-15 at 9:00 a.m for Jury Trial before Branch 10.  Filed, Exhibit List.

Defendant Herman J Beuth in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Herman J Beuth in custody.  
Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of Jury Trial.  Jury in at 9:34 a.m.  Sworn for the state: citizen witness E.B.  Exhibits 6-14 offered and received into evidence and published.  Jury out for break at 10:57 a.m. Jury in at 11:17 a.m.  Sworn for the state: citizen witness Crystal B., Milwaukee Police Officer Amy Stolowski.  Jury out for lunch break at 11:50 a.m.  Sidebar set forth on the record.  Case passed to 1:15 p.m.

SAME APPEARANCES........

Jury trial continued.  Jury in at 1:35 p.m.  Voir dire resumed.  Strikes for cause performed in chambers with both counsel.  Peremptory strikes performed in the presence of the jury.  Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out at 3:09 p.m.  Strikes for cause set forth on the record.  Jury in at 3:34 p.m.; oath to try the issue given.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements made by state and defense.  Jury released for the day at 4:20 p.m. with instruction to return at 9:30 a.m.  Case continued to 6-23-15 at 9:30 a.m. for Jury Trial before Branch 10.

Jury panel in court; oath as to qualifications given.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:14 a.m.  Jury out for noon break at 11:50 a.m.  The Court addresses juror issues with counsel; juror #4 struck for cause.  Case passed until 1:15 p.m.

Defendant Herman J Beuth in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Herman J Beuth in custody.  
Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury trial.  Informal conference held with the parties in chambers prior to case being called on the record.  Parties prepared to proceed to jury trial.  Jury panel requested at this time.

Defendant Herman J Beuth in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Herman J Beuth in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conference held.  State's offer put on the record.  Defendant rejects State's offer. Court informs parties all offers are off the table.  Case remains calendared on 06/22/2015 for jury trial in Branch 10. Case adjourned to Branch 10.
Filed, Final Pretrial Conference Data Sheet.
State's witness list received and filed.

Filed, Defendant's Response to the State's Other Acts Motion.

Defendant Herman J Beuth in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Herman J Beuth in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
